disease_name: Hypercholesterolemia||Mixed dyslipidemia||Cardiovascular disease||Myocardial infarction||Unstable angina pectoris||Hyperlipidemia (post-transplant)
indication: high cholesterol||high blood fat||prevention of cardiovascular events||history of myocardial infarction||unstable angina||post-transplant hyperlipidemia
recommended_usage: take with or without food||at fixed time
single_dose: adults 10-40 mg once a day||cardiovascular prevention 40 mg per day||post-transplant (immunosuppressive therapy) 20 mg per day (up to 40 mg)||renal or hepatic insufficiency 10 mg per day
mechanism_of_action: competitive inhibition of HMG-CoA reductase, reduces cholesterol synthesis, increases LDL receptor expression, increases LDL catabolism, inhibits VLDL synthesis
side_effects: muscle pain||joint pain||muscle cramps||muscle weakness||elevated creatine kinase||increased liver enzymes||dizziness||headache||sleep disturbances||insomnia||nightmares||vision disturbances||blurred vision||double vision||digestive disorders||abdominal pain||nausea||vomiting||constipation||diarrhea||bloating||itching||rash||hives||hair changes||hair loss||difficulty urinating||frequent urination||nocturia||peripheral polyneuropathy||paraesthesia||anaphylaxis||angioedema||lupus erythematosus-like syndrome||jaundice||hepatitis||fulminant hepatic necrosis||rhabdomyolysis||myopathy||interstitial lung disease||diabetes mellitus||dermatomyositis
unsuitable_population: children under 18||pregnant women||breastfeeding women||patients with active liver disease||patients with persistent elevated transaminases||patients with hereditary problems of galactose intolerance, Lapp lactase deficiency, or glucose-galactose malabsorption

indication: inattentive ADHD||impulsivity||hyperactive behavior||behavior problems||difficulty paying attention||difficulty staying focused||difficulty organizing tasks||difficulty listening
recommended_usage: swallowed with water||take with or without food||at fixed time
single_dose: children and adolescents up to 54mg daily||adults up to 72mg daily
mechanism_of_action: changing the amounts of certain natural substances in the brain
side_effects: decreased appetite||dry mouth||sleep disruption||dizziness||stomach ache||increased sweating||headache||nausea||anxiety||weight loss||irritability||slowing of growth in children||seizures||priapism||eyesight changes||blurred vision
unsuitable_population: children under 6||patients with allergy or hypersensitivity to methylphenidate HCI||patients with anxiety||patients with glaucoma||patients with tics or history of Tourette’s syndrome||patients taking monoamine oxidase inhibitors (MAOIs)||patients with heart or mental problems||patients with seizures||patients with abnormal brain wave tests||patients with circulation problems||patients with esophagus, stomach or intestine problems||pregnant women||nursing mothers
storage_conditions: store at room temperature||store in a secure place out of the reach of children

recommended_usage: take with or without food||at fixed time
single_dose: adults 5 mg||adults 10 mg||children over 6 years 2.5 mg||children over 6 years 5 mg
mechanism_of_action: Dilates blood vessels and reduces peripheral vascular resistance
storage_conditions: store at room temperature||keep tightly closed||keep in a dry place||protect from light

disease_name: Human immunodeficiency virus infection||diabetes mellitus||gastrointestinal disorders||peptic ulcers||tuberculosis||Mycobacteria kansasii infection||Mycobacteria xenopi infection
recommended_usage: take with or without food||swallowed with water
unsuitable_population: pregnant women||elderly people||patients with nephropathy||patients with neuropathy||patients with cardiovascular disorders

single_dose: newborns 0.5 mg/kg/dose || pediatric patients <30 kg 1 mg/kg/dose || pediatric patients ≥30 kg adult dosage || adults ≥60 kg 20 mg || adults <60 kg 15 mg
side_effects: peripheral neuropathy||headache||diarrhea||rash||nausea||vomiting||abdominal pain||muscle pain||insomnia||loss of appetite||chills||fever||allergic reactions||blood disorders||hyperglycemia||diabetes||pancreatitis||lactic acidosis||hepatotoxicity||redistribution/accumulation of body fat||severe motor weakness
unsuitable_population: patients with pancreatitis||patients with hepatic decompensation||patients with severe peripheral neuropathy||pregnant women (with caution)||patients with history of lactic acidosis
storage_conditions: store at room temperature||refrigerate||keep tightly closed||keep in a dry place||protect from excessive moisture

mechanism_of_action: helps your body respond better to insulin produced by your pancreas
side_effects: Dizziness||Asthenia||Headache||Nausea||severe skin rash||itching||redness||irritation||pale skin||easy bruising||bleeding||fever||unusual weakness||upper stomach pain||low fever||jaundice||vomiting||loss of appetite||restless||irritable||confusion||hallucinations||muscle pain||muscle weakness||seizure||tired feeling||stomach pain||diarrhea||increased skin sensitivity to sunlight
unsuitable_population: patients hypersensitive to glimepiride||patients hypersensitive to other sulfonylureas||patients hypersensitive to other sulfonamides||patients with type I diabetes mellitus||patients with diabetic ketoacidosis||patients with diabetic precoma or coma||pregnant women||nursing women

single_dose: most patients 5 mg || patients with severe renal impairment 2.5 mg || patients with moderate hepatic impairment 2.5 mg
mechanism_of_action: β-adrenergic receptor blocking; preferentially β1 selective at ≤10 mg; decreases heart rate, decreases myocardial contractility, diminishes sympathetic outflow, suppresses renin activity, vasodilation
unsuitable_population: patients with severe bradycardia||heart block greater than first degree||patients with cardiogenic shock||decompensated cardiac failure||sick sinus syndrome (unless a permanent pacemaker is in place)||patients with severe hepatic impairment (Child-Pugh greater than B)||hypersensitive to any component of this product||children under 18
storage_conditions: store at room temperature||keep tightly closed||protect from light

mechanism_of_action: post-synaptic 5HT1A receptor agonist and 5HT2A receptor antagonist; regulates dopamine, norepinephrine, and serotonin
unsuitable_population: men||postmenopausal women||children||patients with hepatic impairment||patients using alcohol||patients using moderate or strong CYP3A4 inhibitors||patients with hypersensitivity to Flibanserin or any inactive ingredient
storage_conditions: store at room temperature||protect from light||keep in a dry place

side_effects: nausea||dizziness||drowsiness||sleepiness||headache||dyskinesia||increase or decrease in blood pressure||increase or decrease in heart rate||hallucinations||gambling urges||sexual urges||other intense urges
